text:
## 1 Concept Overview

This project implements a physical Spotify track display and control system using an ESP32
[microcontroller. Video demo here.](https://youtu.be/q92Be8mmTjo)

[The device connects to Spotify Web API to display currently playing track information on an](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api)
I2C LCD display and allows users to add songs to their ”Liked Songs” playlist with a single
button press.

[This system could be a good start for a dedicated music device (like the Spotify Car Thing)](https://carthing.spotify.com/)
that bridges the gap between music streaming and physical interaction, making music control
accessible without needing a phone or open the Spotify app.

The project addresses several key questions in IoT and music streaming integration:

  - How can we create more interactions with digital music services?

  - What are the limitations and possibilities when connecting embedded systems to modern
web APIs?

  - How can we optimize data transfer and display on resource-constrained devices?
